page.title: 18HOOK COMMUNITY CENTRE DOUBTS
page.content: Hook Parish Council has clashed with developer Charles Church over the much needed Â£185 000 Community Centre,to be built in Holt Lane on 2 acres of land donated as part of a planning deal. Angry councillors were told 5.5 acres alongside,needed to finally complete the scheme,were no longer guaranteed. The developer also demanded that the 2.2acres now on offer must quickly be accepted or it could be built on.Amid talk of being railroaded and squeezed the dilemma was discussed.The Council must shortly acquire title on the 2.2 acres or lose a Â£50000 H.C.C.grant and risk delaying the project a year.The deal rests on a settlement about the Hook By-Pass between Charles Church, Davis Estates and Hart Council.People interviewed in Hook wondered if there would ever be any community facilities or just many more profitable houses.
